data.name: Finding Happy Prime Numbers
data.description: Happy Prime Numbers --- My boss needs me to make an efficient happy prime number program in order to test the speed of the new equipment we got today! Do you think you can help me write it? (I cheated my way into this job, I don't know how to code). Given an integer num ```2 <= num <= 10,000,000```, can you tell me if it's a happy prime number (a number that is both prime and happy as the name implies)? This code tests efficiency, random tests will go up to 5,000,000 integers, so make sure it's up to my boss's standards! (or else I'm fired, no pressure though). What is a prime number? --- A prime number is a number that is only divisible by the number one and itself. ``` EX) 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13 ... ``` What is a happy number? --- A happy number is when you take the digits of a number, square each of them, and add them. If it eventually reaches the number ```1```, it's a happy number. If it loops infinitely and never reaches ```1```, then it is not a happy number. ``` EX) 19 -> 1^2 + 9^2 = 82 82 -> 8^2 + 2^2 = 68 68 -> 6^2 + 8^2 = 100 100 -> 1^2 + 0^2 + 0^2 = 1 ```
